meanings.definition: Affected with temporary blindness or impaired vision caused by looking at the moon.
meanings.sent1: She felt moonblind after staring at the full moon for too long.
meanings.sent2: The sky was so bright with the full moon that she became moonblind.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was moonblind after the moon decided to play a trick on him.
meanings.sent4: The moon's brightness left her moonblind, unable to see anything else.
meanings.sent5: The moon's light made her feel moonblind, as if it had stolen her vision temporarily.

meanings.definition: Unable to see clearly at night due to the brightness of the moon.
meanings.sent1: The moonblind owl struggled to hunt in the bright moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The moon was so bright that it made her feel moonblind in the darkness.
meanings.sent3: The moon's glow made everything look moonblind, even the shadows.
meanings.sent4: The moon's radiance turned the night into a moonblind world.
meanings.sent5: The moon's brilliance left her feeling moonblind, lost in the night's glow.

meanings.definition: To be temporarily blinded or have impaired vision after looking at the moon.
meanings.sent1: She warned him not to moonblind himself by staring at the full moon.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally moonblinded himself by gazing at the bright moon for too long.
meanings.sent3: They laughed as he moonblinded himself by challenging the moon to a staring contest.
meanings.sent4: The moon's beauty can moonblind anyone who dares to look directly at it.
meanings.sent5: He felt moonblinded after a few moments of staring at the mesmerizing moon.
